So AI detectors think AI wrote the Constitution.

And you still think you can detect AI??

✦ Sure, you see em dashes–everyone does.
✦ Sure, you hate to read the AI expressions like:

1. "It's not [X]. It's [Y]" 

↳ "Credit card fraud isn't just evolving—it's accelerating!"
↳ "The teams who will thrive now aren’t just using AI for speed. They’re combining it with judgment, experience and original thinking."

2. “From X to Y”

↳ "From ancient traditions to modern innovations..”
↳ "From the depth of Linkedin to the realm of..."

3. I listed them all here: https://lnkd.in/dTUF4j-U.

✦ But AI detectors are still a scam.

Andrej Karpathy, one of the creators of ChatGPT, also agrees. You can't detect AI text correctly.

AI detectors are just pattern-matching machines. They learned what “AI text” looks like. And what “human text” looks like.

But here’s the problem.

Humans can write robotic text. AI can write natural text. The two overlap. A lot.

So I wrote an entire guide to master:

1. The truth about AI detection bots.
2. How to forever avoid sounding like an AI.
3. The copy & paste prompt to edit any text and remove its AI feel.

Access the guide here: https://lnkd.in/dTUF4j-U.
